text: don't kid yourself that vampires are
blood sucking shape-shifting battey
entities who dawn long black cloaks and
hunt virgins and flimsy nightgowns
listen to thoughts that maybe in
Transylvania and remote parts of Romania
vampires are soul sucking spirits of the
recently departed who have come back to
spread misery among the living
curiously since the fall of the Iron
Curtain more and more seem to be popping
up
maybe socialism acts like garlic or else
the villagers free from state rule have
succumbed to ancient superstition either
way the vampires are back
consider the tale of mikail Pietra
mikhail was a laborer from a remote
village in transylvania partial to a
drink he lived a quite unremarkable life
until he died in a freak farming
accident not long after his funeral
however mikhail sister-in-law became
limp and lifeless classic symptoms of a
vampire victim friends and family were
convinced that the farmhand had become a
soul-sucking vampire which is why one
dark night in 2003 they exhumed him from
his grave he split his rib cage with a
fork
drew stakes through his body and
sprinkled garlic over his remains
then it got gruesome they pulled out
what was left of his heart and burnt it
the embers were mixed with water and the
fowl cocktail was given to the poor
woman to drink
in the West people live in a very
sanitized world where they don't address
death in their daily lives in
traditional cultures such as we can find
in Romania in the Balkans driving of a
stake through the heart they really do
happen people really do carry out these
things they would seem very freakish to
an urban person but these things persist
in village culture villagers claim that
the sick woman soon became well again
following the ancient ritual but maybe
there's more to the healing powers of
her vampire juice than meets the eye
or she in fact the victim of an ancient
con there is quite a lot of evidence
collected by folklorists it is just that
peasants have had money extorted out of
them for instance to stop the hail
landing on their crops and the same
thing can happen with somebody who's
afraid of bloodsuckers who has that who
has that fear Strigoi vampires call them
what you will the question remains are
they real
as Michelle's family and friends believe
or are they just an ancient con man's
trick in Russian the word vampire
applies not just to a blood sucking
human or animal but also to an evil
magician which just that the word has
actually attached to not the bloodsucker
but the the money sucker
